summary: This is a cover email from defense attorney Christian Everdell to Judge Nathan, submitting under seal the renewed bail motion and accompanying exhibits (F-N) in the case U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell. It demonstrates the defense's ongoing legal efforts regarding Maxwell's pre-trial detention.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP submitting the renewed bail motion and exhibits under seal to the court on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) for whom the renewed bail motion is being filed.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell, to whom the sealed documents are being submitted.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (Cc) of the email regarding the sealed bail motion filing.

persons.context: Listed as a recipient (To) of the email regarding the sealed bail motion filing.

events.title: Renewed Bail Motion Filed Under Seal
events.description: Defense attorneys for Ghislaine Maxwell file a renewed bail motion and accompanying exhibits (F-N) under seal with the court.

locations: 800 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022 (Cohen & Gresser LLP office)
keyFacts: A renewed bail motion for Ghislaine Maxwell was filed under seal on December 8, 2020.
The filing includes numerous exhibits (F through N) that are also under seal.
The defense legal team includes Christian Everdell, Jeff Pagliuca, Laura Menninger, and C Sternheim.
The case is U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), presided over by Judge Nathan.
The documents were submitted pursuant to a prior court order (Dkt. 89).
